text: - I'm Rashmi.

I'm a senior data engineer
at AWS Managed Services.

We provide infrastructure
management to external customers.
(upbeat electronic music)
I've been at Amazon for four years.

So, I was in corporate
finance for about a year,

and then I moved to AMS
looking for a change in teams,
and I wanted to work at AWS,
so I found a data engineer position open.

The greatest achievement
for me working at Amazon

is how I've grown in
my professional career,

not just in my skillset but
just who I am as a person.

I'm very different than
I was four years ago.
I think, working at a pace that Amazon is,
my skillset has been improving 100 X

compared to what I would
have at other companies.
(music continues)
It's because of the nature of the job

and nature of all the
products that need to be built
that have huge, huge impact.
Failure is also encouraged at Amazon,

so this is the best
environment for new people.

You can come experiment, learn,
and ask a lot of questions.
(music continues)
This is purely from my heart:

I absolutely love the
people that I work with;
I cannot stress enough.

They're inspiring, very
dedicated, passionate,
and sometimes, when I don't feel inspired,
I can seek it from them.

And I think we've been
working so much that we've,
I don't think this should be said aloud,
but they're my friends.
These are the people
that I go celebrate their birthdays with.

These are the people that I go
and dance at their weddings.
It's not just about work.

It's like you come here
to build relationships.
(music continues)
